department.dept_long_name: Department of Visual and Environmental Studies

course.title: Where is the Object?: Ambience, Condition, Experience (Studio Course)
course.description: This is a sculpture course concerned with the difficulty of defining entities. For example, what separates an object from the informational and physical conditions surrounding it? And, if every object is in a state of continuous change, can it ever arrive as a complete "thing"? Each week we will read a text, watch something (film, video, slide lecture), and discuss. Students will present their work for group critique approximately three times during the semester.
course.prerequisites: All disciplines are encouraged to enroll, no previous studio experience required.
